main event: A witness observed a bright, oblong object trailing white light over Detroit on October 2, 1966.
interesting points: The object had a brilliant white tail that was about 1 1/2 times longer than its green and red components., The red and green areas of the object were constant while the tail varied slightly in shape., The observer initially mistook the object for a shooting star because of its brightness., The sighting lasted for 3 to 6 seconds before the object disappeared into some trees., The observer was located in a parking lot near the Brightmoor Community Center.
witness description: G. Hambur, a civilian with no military background, claimed high reliability for the sighting.
